abstract.p: The merchant Khoja Salehbhai Sachedina acknowledges that he has received a loan of 4,000 dollars from Bohra Pirbhai Jivanji and mortgages a property until such time as he shall repay the sum plus any accumulated interest. The deed was registered with the British consulate at Zanzibar on the day after its composition. The image of the document is not available to display on this website.

દા. પોતાના—

Towards Bohra Pirbhai Jivanji by the hand of Ismailji Jivanji it is written that I the below signed Khoja
Salehbhai Sachedina took MTD 4000, in words four thousand dollars on interest, its interest
is written and settled at the rate of [symbol], in words half dollar and three annas per one hundred dollars per month, the
agreement is for months – 7 – seven. The interest of above stated dollars from Samvat 1937 Chaitra dated 10 Sunday and
day 234 accumulates upon me. In exchange for the above stated dollars, my plots in Sokomohogo,
which is adjacent to your Sokomohogo property, that I mortgage to you, the
original deeds have been given to you, in that their boundaries and directions are stated, according to that
the mortgage is given in writing to you. When the above stated interest money is given to you, my mortgage becomes
released. This deed I am giving willingly and happily and intelligently in writing, [in] that
the son must abide by the words of the father. Samvat 1937 [Virkhe] Chaitra dated 10 Sunday 235, dated 10 April
Year 1881 AD. The writer Khoja Janmohammadbhai Sachedina gives this writing from the [words] of the creditor.
(Signed) Signed by the writer Khoja Saleh Sachedina – written by himself – of the above 2 deeds, the last is written in Arabic
Written himself —

Produced by Sachedina and registered at his request at the office of H.M. Agency and Consulate G. at Zanzibar
this 11th day of April 1881
Fred. Holmwood H.M. Consul
Zanzibar
